Total Time: 44 minutes
 
 Category: Dinner
 
 Serving Size: 4
 
 Ingredients:
 4 boneless chicken breasts
 1 large egg
 1/2 cup milk
 3 tbsp. olive oil
 8 slices mozzarella cheese
 1 (24 oz.) pasta sauce 
 1/2 cup parmesan cheese
 8 oz. spaghetti pasta 
 

Instructions:
 1. Gather the ingredients
 2. Heat the oven to 350 degrees F
 3. Lightly grease a 9 x 13-inch baking dish
 4. Put the chicken breasts between sheets of plastic wrap and gently pound to about 1/2 inch in thickness.
 5. Whisk together the egg and milk in a bowl.
 6. Put the seasoned breadcrumbs in a different, wide, shallow bowl.
 7. Dip the chicken breasts in milk and egg mixture and then in breadcrumbs, turning to coat thoroughly.
 8. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or saute pan over medium-high heat.
 9. Brown the chicken in the hot oil on both sides until golden brown, about 3 to 4 minutes on each side. Arrange the chicken in the prepared baking dish.
 10. Slice 8 pieces of mozzarella cheese and put two on each chicken breast. Pour 1 jar of your favorite spaghetti sauce over all. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and a little more mozzarella and bake for about 25 to 30 minutes, or until bubbly.
 11. Meanwhile, cook the spaghetti or linguine in boiled salted water following package directions. Drain well.
 12. Serve and Enjoy!
